title: 2br - $2200 / 2 bd room apt. (yonkers ny)
posting_body: ['While rents are going up everywhere in the NYC metro area, this rent is about 3k less than what you find in the metro area and a great location and safe location as well.', ' No shootings, muggings, assaults in this hood..', 'Safe walk to metro north..', 'By Owner..2 bedroom/1bath apt for rent.', 'fresh paint.', '2nd floor.', '10 min walk to metro north station in woodlawn, 20 min commute to grand central station.', 'Heat and water included.', '$ 2200 per month.', '1st, last, security and references.', 'accommodates 3 personas', 'Huge eat in kitchen, tall ceilings, extra storage areas, wood floors.', 'Street parking', 'TO QUALIFY FOR THIS APARTMENT FOLLOW THE 30% RENT RULE...', 'In simple terms, the 30% rule recommends that your monthly rent payment not be more than 30% of your gross monthly income.', '...', 'That would leave 70% of your gross monthly income to cover other necessities, such as utilities and food, discretionary spending, debt repayment, and savings.', 'Rule of Thumb: How Much Should You Spend on Rent? -', 'The <URL> › ... › Real Estate Resources', 'Search for: 30% rent rule', 'HOW MUCH DO I HAVE TO EARN IN ORDER TO AFFORD  $2200 A MONTH IN RENT..', 'You may have heard of the general rule of thumb here, which is that 30% of your monthly income should go to rent.', "If you make $7800 a month at your job, that's $1950 that you can afford to spend in housing costs.", '(Another way to calculate this is to take your entire yearly income and divide it by 40.)Feb 8, 2019', 'How Much Rent Can You Afford? - <URL> › tips › how-much-rent-can-you...', '2200 a month..its a no brainier..', 'Call business # 10AM -5 PM   # 914 776 9139, lv msg if no one answers.........(THIS MEANS NO E-MAILS!!-BECAUSE YOU WILL BE WASTING YOUR TIME...why you ask?', 'BECAUSE THIS AD IS POSTED AS A SERVICE TO THE OWNER OF THIS PROPERTY.', 'THE PERSON WHO POSTED THIS DOES NOT OWN THE PROPERTY!!!!)']
